description: Synthetic peptide, 32 residues long formulated as a nasal spray.
doseSchedule: 200 [iU] Spray, metered form with nasal route
mechanismOfAction: Calcitonin binds to the calcitonin receptor (found primarily in osteoclasts) which then enhances the production of vitamin D producing enzymes (25-hydroxyvitamine D-24-hydroxylase), leading to greater calcium retention and enhanced bone density. Binding of calcitonin to its receptor also activates adenylyl cyclase and the phosphatidyl-inositol-calcium pathway.
name: Salmon Calcitonin
